The post processor translates the toolpath data generated by the CAM system into a format that is compatible with a specific computer numerical control (CNC) machine tool. This allows the CNC machine to read and execute the toolpath data, enabling the physical creation of the part designed in the CAD/CAM system. The post processor takes into account the specific characteristics of the machine tool, such as the number and type of axes, the type and number of spindles, and the type and number of tool changers, to generate the necessary machine-specific code.
